physDesc.p: This is a two page letter with no rips or tears throughout the pages. It has the word “Poetry” at the top left corner of the page with “Monroe” written underneath in pencil.

div.p: I am enclosing the proofs corrected. I am perfectly delighted to find that “Red Slippers” is to be inserted. That gratifies me very much and remove my imbittered feelings. Fletcher’s articles and my poems are certainly a very handsome tribute to me in one number.

You made rather an unfortunate mistake in you March number by mentioning me as the editor of “Some Imagist Poets”. I thought I had carefully explained to you that there was no editor. We all chose our own poems. May I ask you to publish the enclosed letter in your April number, as I think it only fair to the rest of the group not to give any one the impression that I sat in judgment on their verses. I am sure you will publish this, as recall your well-meant but unfortunate note is liable to embroil me severely with the other poets in the volume, and they would be quite right to feel this way had the note been inspired by me, as some of them may very well think.

As to your remarks about my feelings in regard to Ezra’s not being in the Anthology, they shall pass as far as the public is concerned, but personally I had rather you had left the matter unmentioned, as this will give Ezra the feeling that I am whining for him, which I am very far from doing. However, just publish the letter as it stands, there’s a good girl, and I have done all I can to put myself straight. These Poets are touchy people, and not for a moment would I have them think that I arrogated to myself a position which was not mine.
